page.title: 03Redhill council house sale
page.content: This year(1985) Woodspring council wanted to buy back two council houses in Redhill which were said to be unfit for human habitation. Woodspring said that the walls were defective and the blockwork crumbling. Altogether there were six similar houses,of which four had been sold to tenants.Two of these had been bought back,but the other two owners had extended their houses and were satisfied with them as they were.They therefore refused to sell them back to the council. A compulsory purchase order is to be sought so that the whole site can be developed.
